description:
This module represents the second part of the analysis of real estate capital markets. It covers the real estate debt capital markets. Topics include the economics of mortgage securitisation; the various mortgage-backed securitisation instruments, models and structures; the concepts of pooling and
tranching; secondary mortgage institutions and the US experience in real estate debt securitisation; commercial and residential mortgage-backed securities; embedded pre-payment and default options; rating agencies and risk analyses; as well as the policy implications and relevant lessons for markets from the 2007-2009 Financial Crisis.
title: Real Estate Securitisation
